content:
34 Bolivia Restores Ties with U.S. on President Rodrigo Paz’s First Day in Office After 20 Years of Socialist Rule (www.breitbart.com) YES posted 8 hours ago by TEXinLA 1 comments award share report block Bolivia Restores Ties with U.S. on President Rodrigo Paz's First Day in Office After 20 Years of Socialist Rule Bolivian President Rodrigo Paz restored his country's full diplomatic ties with the United States in the first hours of his administration. www.breitbart.com
1 comments Sort by Top Top New Worst Old Save TEXinLA OP 2 points 8 hours ago From the article: Paz, a former senator of the moderate Christian Democratic Party (PDC), took office on Sunday, becoming Bolivia’s new president for the next five years. His inauguration marked the end two decades of MAS’s anti-U.S. rule in the South American country — first under failed wannabe dictator and fugitive of the law on pedophilia allegations Evo Morales and then under Luis Arce. permalink award report block reply
TEXinLA OP 2 points 8 hours ago From the article: Paz, a former senator of the moderate Christian Democratic Party (PDC), took office on Sunday, becoming Bolivia’s new president for the next five years. His inauguration marked the end two decades of MAS’s anti-U.S. rule in the South American country — first under failed wannabe dictator and fugitive of the law on pedophilia allegations Evo Morales and then under Luis Arce. permalink award report block reply
